metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15124 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description: VNC server implementation in Quick Emulator (QEMU) 2.11.0 and older wasfound to be vulnerable to an unbounded memory allocation issue, as it didnot throttle the framebuffer updates sent to its client. If the client didnot consume these updates, VNC server allocates growing memory to hold ontothis data. A malicious remote VNC client could use this flaw to cause DoSto the server host.

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
